headline: Packaging Corp. Is Worst Stock in S&P 500 Today After Earnings. Here’s Why.
summary: Packaging Corp. of America  stock was the worst performer in the  on Wednesday after the container products company said it expects various headwinds in the first quarter of 2025.  Shares of  Packaging  closed down 9.8% to $215.12, marking the largest same-day percentage decrease since Sept. 16, 2022, according to Dow Jones Market Data.  Adjusted earnings of $2.47 a share were below the FactSet consensus estimate of $2.53, while revenue increased 11% to $2.15 billion, better than Wall Street’s call for $2.13 billion.

headline: Packaging Corp Of America: Valuation Appears Too High Given Margin Pressure
summary: Packaging Corp Of America gained 40% in the past year but fell 5% after Q4 results missed estimates, adding to my concerns about valuation. Read my PKG thesis.
